member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Controllers.ControllerObjectReference
member.summary: Represents a real or virtual controller (or an object within a controller) that is referenced by RobotStudio.
member.remarks: This class does not contain any methods for interacting with the controller. Using the property you can create an instance of the Controller class, from the namespace ABB.Robotics.Controllers of PC SDK, in order to interact with the contoller.

member.summary: Represents a collection of recently connected controllers

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Controllers.RecentControllerCollection.Add(ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Controllers.ControllerObjectReference)
member.summary: Adds a controller to the recent list.
member.remarks: If an entry with the same system id is already present, it will be replaced. Also, any entry with a different system id, but the same controller name and system name will be replaced. Virtual controllers will not be added.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Controllers.ControllerManager
member.summary: Provides information about real and virtual controllers referenced by RobotStudio. Use the classes of the ABB.Robotics.Controllers namespace of PC SDK to actually work with the controllers. Using the controller manager you can find out which controllers that are currently referenced by RobotStudio, either because they belong to a Station, or are added from the Online Tab.

member.summary: Returns a collection of controllers currently referenced by RobotStudio.

member.summary: Returns a collection of controllers recently connected to

member.remarks: Null is returned if more than one controller object is selected.
